body_html:
In the original issue, the surprise was you run tf.train.match_filenames_once was run to generate list of testing filenames. Then pre-trained model was loaded from checkpoint, which overwrote this list with training filenames. 100% test set accuracy, woohoo!

Saved filenames are useful to restore while training a model, but are not useful to restore when loading this model for testing. It seems there needs to be some kind of distinction between model parameters and checkpointed things that are not model parameters.

Saved filenames are useful to restore while training a model, but are not useful to restore when loading this model for testing. It seems there needs to be some kind of distinction between model parameters and checkpointed things that are not model parameters.
body:
In the original issue, the surprise was you run `tf.train.match_filenames_once` was run to generate list of testing filenames. Then pre-trained model was loaded from checkpoint, which overwrote this list with training filenames. 100% test set accuracy, woohoo!

Saved filenames are useful to restore while training a model, but are not useful to restore when loading this model for testing. It seems there needs to be some kind of distinction between model parameters and checkpointed things that are not model parameters.
